caption: Beautiful ambiance and good quality food

We had a reservation for 7:30 last night. We got seated at 8:00 . Last time we went there we had our temperatures taken and this time it wasn’t the case. Since we sat later than our time we were pretty hungry. We ordered drinks and appetizers. We ordered the special which was herbed rice with red snapper and kuku sabzi (for Persian new year) the price was pretty high but we thought oh it will be awesome. We were very disappointed. Food was cold , rice was very dry . Definitely not worth it. I really wanted to like it but it was not good. I am not sure if they were overwhelmed because of too many people or they just got too commercialized. Also the music was too loud and it was techno music . Definitely not suitable for Persian new year and Rumi! Not sure if we will go there again , we drove all the way from Fairfax and our first impression was so good that I was very excited but our neighborhood persian restaurant has much better new Year food than they did .
It was amazing. You need to try the lamb, like it was the absolute bomb. The kubideh was so good as well. Overall 9/10!!!!
Excellent, Nowruz Pirouz!
Certainly one of the best restaurants in DC. Delicious food, fair price, great service! Highly recommended
Very nice atmosphere and food.
Service and food is amazing. Everything perfect
Great food and very good ambience.
Great food atmosphere and staff. I went there twice in the two days I was in town.👍
Real authentic Persian food!
Fine dining atmosphere with delicious food and excellent service at a very reasonable price.
Best Persian food experience yet! John our server and bartender was amazing Tehran mule cocktail is a must And omg food is great The atmosphere is so relaxing and I just loved everything about it

The food was good. My wife, who made the reservation for Valentine’s Day, had written to ask if they could accommodate a pescatarian diner, and they agreed. When we got there, they were nevertheless surprised. It worked out, but was a bit uncomfortable.
Verynice

Some of the best Persian food that I've had from a restaurant. The service is impeccable. The Black Rose cocktail is wonderful. We ordered the duck fessenjoon, koobideh, ghormeh sabzi and the sea bass. All of them were excellent. And you can mix and match the rice, so try them all! Felt very comfortable with the cleanliness and covid-19 precautions taken. Highly recommend and will return to this restaurant.
Best customer service ever
Nice atmosphere, great food and Super nice stuff, I didn’t give  five stars because it’s little bit pricey!

I just love this place & their service. I have ate at the restaurant at least a dozen times if not more, gotten take out for when I’ve had guests at home, and every time the quality of the food is amazing. And of course the service is always great 👍 Claudia the manager always takes good care of me 🙏

Beautifully designed, respectful staff, clean environment, and tasty food. Beef barg kabob was soft and tender, not overcooked, made to perfection, exploding in flavor with each bite. I can say that was the best barg kabob I ever had in DC area. Ghormeh Sabzi was good in overall. Herbs were overcooked (overfired actually) to me, made the Ghormeh Sabzi tastes bitter a little bit. But the fact is that many people like Ghormeh Sabzi in this fashion (with overcooked herbs) . So, it's not fair if I deduct points (stars) because of this.
The best Kabob I ate in America. Perfect taste of Tehran Kababs.
Great Persian food at affordable prices. Went to the location in Alpharetta, GA and decided to give DC a try for special occasion. Rumi's DC did not disappoint and had a great meal.

The best in the area with professional customer service. Barg Kebab is specially the best you can find in the area. The kebabs are tender, juicy, and well done. Just one comment: If make the food less salty, that would be great.
Fantastic middle eastern food

Persian fathers are the most merciless perfectionist critics known to mankind. Hence, when my dad recommended Rumi's I knew it was going to be absolutely INCREDIBLE! The food is spectacular, the service phenomenal, the presentation flawless, the experience legendary.  I'm not in the restaurant industry but as a veteran business owner I can't express how much I appreciate the owner and staffs fastidious attention to detail and execution. The koobideh, joojeh and barg are succulent and excellent. The Mirza ghasemi smoky with just the right amount of garlic and Persian ice cream tastes like heaven. My favorite part the Tahdig (crispy rice) was fresh, light and so perfect.  I've lived in LA and have been to 28 countries, this is the best authentic Persian food and exceptional service you'll find outside of Tehran. Everything from top to bottom was literally magnificent. Some of the self-proclaimed "fine-dining" DC restaurateurs should come dine here and take lessons from a bona fide master.

Great service!, very polite servers, we had 3 main separate orders, with an appetizer, BUT not a very authentic Persian dishes, the stew (gormesabzi) was exteeeeeemly salty, no taste but salt!, they served the CHENGE KABOB with LOBIA POLO with meat in it extreeem cinnamon, no Persian cook makes kabob with LOBIA BOLO & CHOPED MEAT!! with half pound of cinnamon in it, feel like eating breakfast, couldn’t taste the kabob at all, kabob should comes with white rice. Lam shank dish tasted like warm water, We have mentioned it and tadig and gormesabzi (appetizer) was credited. Very regular quality of food, not very tasty AND most of all, well, very pricy for IMITATION Persian food. I honestly can not go back specially when I think of $224 I paid for 3 dishes and two glass of wine.

From the Chilean Sea Bass to the Gheymeh, everything here was juicy, flavorful, and fresh. Their lamb hummus was to die for and don’t get me started on the drinks. There isn’t a Persian restaurant in the area that is THIS good. It’s comparable to kabob in Iran.

Delicious very authentic Persian style fine dining cuisine. Bold middle eastern flavors with all the traditional sides. Service is well trained and friendly. They help guide any newcomers through the Persian experience.  The spice mist cocktail was a perfect balance of sweet and spicy, cheers to the bartender.  Claudia the general manager was very friendly and welcoming, Thank you! Looking forward to coming back very soon.
This is now one of my favorite places to go for Persian food 🤩 great service and food and overall, this is a gem of spot! Highly recommended.
Delicious food intimate experience superior service #gs5secondreview #theGspot

Good food, excellent  service. One of the items we ordered wasn’t cooked well and we had to return it. The chef & manager both wanted to make sure whatever it was about the food that wasn’t right was fixed and to our satisfaction. They brought us 3 fully plated portions of the said item until we were fully satisfied with its taste and texture. Have never seen such dedication from staff to get things right for the customer.
Great ambiance, service, and food.
Authentic Persian dishes . The duck fesenjon was extraordinary good. The staff are nice and welcoming.. highly recommended

I lost the list I wrote of all the fabulous employees here who helped us but without fail the entire staff was incredible. They had fires to keep us warm while sitting outside thanks to cooft-vid ruining indoor seating. Their food is truly the best iranian food in DC. Cons: I despise the mannequins, but others seem to enjoy them. Also don't like the mast-o-mooseer (shallot yogurt) because the shallots aren't one with the yogurt. They're finely diced and delicious, but not what I expected. They were super accommodating and allowed me to get the kashk e bademjoon instead which in my opinion is the superior appetizer. The koobideh made me feel like I was in Tehran because of how amazing it was. I felt like I could close my eyes and be transported home! Truly delicious, what an experience :)
SO so so good. The food is authentic persian food and cooked so well. The service is great as well. I will definitely going back again.
Hreat restaurant, service and food.
Fantastic Persian food with stellar service - been there 3 times now and has also been consistent with their great food/service. Keep up the great work!!
Good food, great service, nice people. You can sit outside with heaters🙂
poor customer service and restaurant management

We got takeout once and dined at the recently expanded patio once. Service was great each time. I don't know how the owner can afford to pay all the staff considering the Covid situation. You have to check your temperature as you walk in. There is a small bottle of sanitizer for you to use at your table. The menu was touchless but unfortunately the payment was not touchless and you had to sign the old fashioned way.  Each time we had the Soltani kabob and paid $3 extra to get fava beans rice. The first time I liked the barg kabob a little better. It was cooked more to a medium. The second time, the Koobideh kabob leftover was a bit salty but the one at the restaurant was delicious and not salty.  We also had the Kashk Badenjoon. It was pretty good and very popular as we saw it passing by a few times. We also had the Hummus with smoked salmon. The hummus was tasty but salty. The salmon was nice and smoky. We finished up with a bowl of delicious Persian ice cream with plenty of saffron and pistachios. Update We picked up koobideh with baghelipolo. It was a little salty but tasted pretty good.  Update The koobideh was pretty good. One was juicer than the other. Falafel plate was a good value. It came with a bit of hummus, torshi, pickled beets and tabouli. The complimentary herbs and feta plate was very fresh.

This place is amazing Food was so good Portions are huge  If you aren't starving, you can do with an appetizer and 1 main dish!  Service was great, the guy was so friendly and kept checking in on us and explaining everything about the food and the menu.  Definitely worth coming back to.
Reservation bad, food kind of ok but not perfect.  So expensive vs quality of food.

Friends and I went all-out and ordered this for takeout last night (sorry for not having great plating in pics) - we were very pleased! Let me give you the run-down.  *Note that they have a significant amount of heated outdoor dining space if you prefer, as well as indoor dining with temperature checks at the door.  Poussin (the hen) - I thought this was the best dish of the night! Blew me away with how tender it was. While I haven't had the boneless chicken here, one kabob rookie mistake is ordering the boneless chicken (you always get the bone-in). But wow was the hen way more tender than any bone-in chicken I've had elsewhere; and the flavor profile was this super unique lemon mix.  Soltani (mix of koobideh + tenderloin): my friends' favorite was the koobideh. I've never been the biggest fan but it was certainly tasty. The tenderloin was very good.  The lamb - definitely my second favorite dish of the night - holy cow! the subtle mint flavor really wow'd me.  Duck Fesenjoon - definitely tasty and enjoyed the pomegranate seeds and unique sauce.  Fried eggplant - definitely tasty, recommend for eggplant fans.  Rumi's yogurt - very delicious as expected.  Note that all dishes are served with lots of bread/rice (therefore you want something like the yogurt).  Kabob is great for takeout because it transports well (isn't super greasy or anything).  If I had to sum it up, if you're going to dinner with 2-3 people, my highest recommendations would be picking a combo of the poussin (hen), lamb, and koobideh, along with a yogurt dip or two.  Also I really thought the online ordering + pickup experience was excellent. Our meal was ready within about 20 mins of ordering (on a Fri night), so I'd recommend calling in that amount ahead of time rather than waiting to receive the confirmation text message that it's ready for pickup.  Looking forward to returning!

(Translated by Google) One of the best restaurant in DC Downtown with a very delicious type of gastronomy. The servers are very friendly.  Super recommended.  (Original) Uno de los mejores restaurante en DC Downtown con un tipo de gastronomía muy deliciosa. Los meseros son muy amables.  Súper recomendado.
Awesome Persian food with great presentation and services.

I can’t stop raving about Rumi’s Kitchen! The ambiance is perfect for a romantic dinner or a cute dinner with friends.  What made this experience so special is the manager. Claudia was exceptional and answered all our questions as it relate to the menu. Claudia was kind enough to let me taste the gravy that accompanied the Duck Fesenjoon which is a pomegranate and walnut stew after I was wasn’t sure if I would like the dish.  Sia, our server, was kind and patient as we navigated the menu. She frequently checked in and ask if we needed anything.  The food at Rumi’s Kitchen speaks for itself. But it’s the fantastic customer service that made my experience exceptional.
6 stars 😉
Very authentic Persian food with great taste!
Great food and staff

My parents and I really enjoyed your experience at the restaurant. They really thought about every little thing to make you enjoy your experience: from the mannequins in the dining room to the Rumi quotes on your napkins. The food was also phenomenal. I got the cornish hen with zereshk polo and it was so good. Most persian restaurants are known for the kabobs , and so it was great to try a menu item that felt more home-y and similar taste to eating in Iran. Also, the yogurt duo (shallot one is amazing).  Loved it all.
A bit expensive but totally worth it
The food is heavenly and the serive is great!
Absolutely delicious authentic persian food! Baghali polo is a must try!
We went there last Sunday. The food was good but pricy. If you have a deep pocket enjoy it.

Food quality in Rumi is great, the best I have had in U.S so far. The service was also very good, our table was cleaned after each course, water glass was never left empty, the server made sure we had all the information about what we were ordering and if we were happy with the food. Will definitely go back there!

Truly a terrific tasting meal. Not a loser from herb/bread starter plate to the very final sip of tea. Big dishes, plenty to take home at the end. Tahdig and lamb rack were my favorites.  Alas a hot restaurant means it's pretty packed. Add covid spacing and you need a reservation. Staff was hustling to make it all work, which they get huge credit for.  We ran in to reservation/pre-meal issues. They don't guarantee outdoor seating (I called day-of and they said "most likely have room" but arrive early and ask), but even when requested on arrival, the hostess couldn't estimate a wait time. Was "soon" 10 mins or 40? They couldn't say. First a table was "being bussed" and then ten mins later, "they've paid." When I asked if there was an indoor table, there wasn't one available for our existing reservation. Hmm - this isn't like overbooking a flight, I'd hope. Could we order a drink while waiting? Only if you pressed the bar yourself. In the end, we waited 45 mins. A little smoothing of their process will bring their pre-meal experience up to the level of their food, which is great!
The place was amazing! Only  but the food is worse i didn’t liked it at all .

The best Iranian restaurant in Washington DC I loved our experience. The staff very friendly and the atmosphere is lovely all were wearing masks  and practicing social distancing between tables also hand sanitizers were on the table for guests
The kubidah is amazing

What a great night!! Rumi Kitchen was absolutely, positively delicious. The upscale atmosphere is so classy and yet warmly welcoming. The service is top notch. Gaven was our server. I will say he was the best we ever had. He was so attentive. His anticipation of our needs was amazing. Our glasses were never empty, dirty dishes were cleared immediately, and we were never left waiting for something we needed. He took the time to explore our food preferences and was then able to make customized recommendations. For appetizers we ordered labne, falafel, and Rumi's Wings.  We split the Soltani Kabob meal and ended with baklava for dessert. Can I just say scrumptious?  So, so good!  The meats were tender, the flavor was delicious, and the portions very generous. During our meal the general manager Claudia came over to talk to us. She was so friendly and made sure our night was wonderful. This restaurant is a well oiled machine. All the employees work together as a team and truly make you feel like family. We've eaten a lot of Persian food over the years but this is, by far, the tastiest we've ever had. Please do yourself a favor and make a reservation now....you will not regret it😋
excellent food
Excellent service,  neat and clean place, very tasty food,  very professional staff
Food is excellent but service is slow and not attentive I waited for my check for a long time to come. It was packed though.
Chicken barg, lamb rack, kale salad, grilled shrimp. The mains come with way too much rice. Ask to sub a salad.
The feasts are very much feasts, come hungry! It was great Persian
A chic Persian restaurant in DC. They have great food presentation as you can see in the pictures.
very nice food and amazing customer services $$$

This place had a great persian ambience and drinks with delicious dishes (although it was  customized to regional tastes). Our dining began with a bad experience in allocating a table to us but down the road, the professional behavior of the manager Sarah, brought us a very pleasant experience.

The best Persian food In town! The Ambiance and the staff are also phenomenon! We made a reservation and were seated right away after we arrived. There are hand sanitizers on each table and plenty of space between the tables. Our new favorite spot!
Staff were nice and professional, food was not  qualified for that price, you pay for advertising  only, if you like to have better food , there are more convenient , priceless Persian food ,

Good food. Ok service. The server seemed to be in a hurry all the time. Would have given it higher rating if the server was not so rushed. And the young man never even asked us once if we would like another drink. Kinda strange, considering the prices at this place. Still gave him a very hefty tip. Overall,  lacks class.
Foods are great and customer service is professional, ask for Leo he is the best s server and his such nice guy.
Amazing food and service. Top of the line.

Amazing! Came in from Virginia for an anniversary weekend, no reservations, got sat right away, and Crystal out waitress was super. Will recommend friends and family when they visit DC. Food phenomena and drinks on point! Great atmosphere, will visit again for sure.

This was our first time at Rumis Kitchen. Based on the reviews I was truly expecting the most amazing meal ever. While the food was good, it wasn't anything special. The apps were interesting enough and filling, but the entrees are were they lacked.  We ordered mainly kabob, barg and koobideh. All three were very plain, while mixed with flavor it wasn't out of this world someone can make at any other restaurant. Maybe I wasn't paying attention, but imo it's just okay.  Atmosphere and music was great, service was good enough, but with Covid I would appreciate if they didn't drop the utensils on the table with bare hands.

The food was absolutely delicious and I would definitely come back here again. Excellent spot. Healthy eats. They have outdoor seating.Good location, plenty of parking. Server was very helpful with the choices. This is one of my favorite places! Love the high quality and fresh food that they serve.

This was our second time there, and we love the food. However, today I had to change my baby’s diaper and there is no changing table. Once I asked the manager, he said this is their design and even the Atlanta store doesn’t have one! Well, I will change review to a five star once you install a changing table and notify me. Because we want to come back!

Great atmosphere, delicious food. Servings are huge and perfect for sharing. They have a really nice outdoor space and the staff is very attentive. It's hard to save room for dessert but definitely worth it. The faloude is very light and refreshing. The owner was there during our visit and spent time engaging with all the customers.
Excellent service, great ambiance and tasty food, loved the place and will go back soon.

First time I went to this Rumi’s Kitchen, I had a wonderful experience. As we sat down, we were served bread, cheese and different lettuce as starter. Kubideh Kabob as entree and rice. Rice were perfectly cooked and kabob was also perfect. I could have enjoyed kabobs more if there were little more seasoning in them rather plain or adding more on top.  Could add chili sauce on the side add bit of spice to food. Service was excellent.  You must reserve a week or two prior to your visit.  Overall it was great experience.
The food is awesome snd delicious. warm hospitality by Mr.Ali, the owner of the restaurant. I highly recommend to everyone the Rumi restaurant.😍
I can say this is the best Persian restaurant in the US I’ve ever been. The food is extremely tasty. Very clean environment. Polite staff. Thank you Ali

We loved the food so much we went back a second time in a week. For appetizers we ordered the two yogurts ( masto khiar and masto musir), mirza ghazemi. They also gave sabzi, paneer,and walnuts with bread. Very delicious! We ordered for dinner barg, lubia polo with chinjeh, shish kabob, and lamb kabob. All the meat was excellent. Very juicy and tender. I've had better lubia polo. For desert we ordered faloudeh and the cinnamon cake. Loved the faloudeh!! Cinnamon cake was average. The second time at the restaurant we ordered barg, koobideh, and gormeh sabzi. All were great and faloudeh again for dessert.

Great ambiance. Superb presentation. Excellent service. Tasty cocktails and appetizers. However, my entree was not very flavorful. Perhaps, I’ll try a different course on the menu next time.....the cozy atmosphere and soft lighting definitely contributed to capturing Rumi’s essence ❤️
I gave them a second chance it was much better.

I had such a great experience at Rumi’s Kitchen. The reservation system was easy and they call you to confirm you still want your table. They take temperatures before letting guests sit down and the tables are spaced out to accommodate social distancing. The food was BEYOND amazing. The ghormeh sabzi tahdig was delicious and plenty for a table of 4, the beef soltani was juicy and flavorful, the chicken wings were also very good. The service was incredible, I was very impressed. Highly recommend for anyone looking for delicious Persian food and great service in the city.

If you go to this persian resturant, you would never go anywhere else. The price is in higher range, but totally worth it. This is the place to take all your not persian friends to. You would love it, both the atmosphere and the food!!!! So happy they open a branch in DC Area!!!

Decided to try this restaurant for dinner after reading Tom Sietsema's review. Excellent choice! Enjoyed sitting outside at large patio with heaters. Loved the sea bass entree. Interior is beautiful! Great staff! My waiter Domingo was superb!
What a treat! Excellent food, exceptional service, beautiful ambience! Finally, a great place to eat delicious Persian food.
Amazing place with delicious food and very nice atmosphere 🤩 The service is at the highest level 👌
Excellent authentic Persian dishes....from their appetizers, to the main course, deserts, wines and cocktails.... service is second to none!  Don't miss this fantastic dining experience!!
Food, ambiance and staff are all great.

Everything was 5 star, for the Ambience to the service and the food!! We ordered a bunch so we could pick our favorite and we loved everything we ordered. I have to say, if anyone from the restaurant is reading these reviews, that the food was a little on the khosh namak side! Still very high quality and tasty!  Definitely will going back!

As a persian myself - the food was amazing. I felt that Rumi's Kitchen was able to capture flavors that you can sometimes only get in a persian household. The meats were tender and I loved the balancing elements that came with certain dishes, such as torshi (pickled vegetables) and the mast-o-moussir (garlic yogurt). Highly recommend the Chinjeh Lubia Polo and the Kashk Badenjoon.  One caveat is that this is definitely a restaurant that's at a significantly higher price point than most staple persian restaurants in the area. I'd still recommend going to this restaurant if you plan to fully explore persian food beyond basic kabobs.
Great food, lovely staff, and the bartenders know their cocktails. Definitely coming back!
Food was great, but service was average. Waited forever to get the check and a to-go box.
Perfect persian restaurant in DC area
The good was good, great ambience and the staff was very gracious and friendly. We had a good time last night

Delicious appetizers, best barg kabob (beef tenderloin) I had around DC, and have the tea after! Beautiful design and details!!! Customer service was great as well. We needed this restaurant in DC area.
Great food, price high, staff so great, bathroom clean, drinks pricey, location nice, parking problem I will go back please try it..
The wait was worth every bit of every bite. Definitely will be back next time we’re visiting DC.
If you want delicious Persian food in a nice place this is the place to be. Try their Seabass and they’re all albalo polo ( Sour cherry rice) and also try the lamb!
Everything is delicious. Incredible torshi, wish I could buy in bulk!

This was my first time trying Rumi restaurant. I really impressed with the quality of food. Everything was perfect. Clean environment, friendly staffs and more importantly delicious dishes. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Best Sultani, ambiance and the service 👌🏼👌🏼coming back soon
Excellent
High quality food and top notch service.

We had a great experience at Rumi last nite. Professional staff. Great food. The decor is understated and beautiful. Also creative approach to social distancing.  I love the the freshly baked bread with cheese and sabzie also my eggplant stew was delicious.
We had a fabulous dinner at Rumi’s Kitchen tonight. The food and the service was great. Professional staff and manager...I can not wait for next visit Rumi’s...
Truly the best Persian restaurant I’ve ever been, delicious and tasty food, professional staffs with great service and wonderful environment! Definitely recommend this place to everyone!!!!
Excellent service and high quality Persian dishes
About the best Persian food you can have anywhere outside Iran.  Great quality and beautiful presentation. Indeed it is equally appeasing to your taste buds and retina.

Amazing food, great experience and wonderful service. We truly enjoyed it. Our server was very kind and professional as well.  We ordered Tahdig and Khoresht, Lamb Rack, Lamb Shish Kabob, Filet Kabob, Albaloo Polo, Shirin Polo, Special yogurt and Baklava.
Food was so good, even ate dessert... I could not stop eating!
Excellent food and great service.

An excellent spot in terms of  food, atmosphere, and service. I'll be back again and often. It's unique for two reasons. First, unlike most Persian restaurants, they non-kabob dishes are highlights, not afterthoughts. Second, it combines a modern, nice dining experience with traditional dishes that don't bastardize the food but does show creativity (for example, with the cocktails).  To those unfamiliar with Persian food, I suggest you go family style and try more than just the kabob (though that it truly excellent). Winners at our table were the eggplant dip (kashk bhadenjoon), yogurts, lamb shank, ghormeh sabzi (stewed herbs and beef), lubia polo (tomato, beef, and bean stew), and Baghali polo (herbed rice with lima beans).
Great place!
Nice place and friendly staff. The food is really delicious.
Amazing Persian food, but pricey. Personally loved the seafood options as it gave a twist to standard Persian. Excellent desserts. Must go since you can have Persian food and cocktails

There is only one two person table on the outside patio. We had a reservation and had requested outdoor seating. When we arrived, the hostess told us that the party of two had finished eating and that we would be seated at the table as soon as they left. Unfortunately, the party of two sat talking for THREE HOURS (after they were already done eating and had been given their to-go boxes, they sat talking for another hour while we stood on the sidewalk by the dog poop waiting). We stood outside waiting for them to leave for an hour!!  The couple just sat with their to-go food boxes chit chatting. This isn't a coffee shop. I don't understand why the manager didn’t explain that other customers are there. Hogging the table for three hours on a Saturday night DURING A PANDEMIC when there is only patio seating for 4 separate tables (and only one 2-person table). Doesn't the restaurant care about staying in business? We got eaten alive by mosquitos standing in the street by the dog poop. These people are selfish. Zaytinya and other restaurants explain there is a two hour limit for outside tables during COVID. Why didn’t this restaurant do that??? Why make us wait? The food was decent but certainly not worth the wait.
Everything is so perfect at this new place! Staff, song, food, interior design, the management team! They did a good job! Well done and Thank you Rumi’s !
Every single dish we tried was incredible. The lamb & hummus and beef kabob were particular standouts. Already looking forwarding to eating at Rumi's again!

It was amazing. Super delicious, fresh, and tasteful. I always try their wings and beef/lamb chenjeh. As good as the very best ones  back in Iran. I wasn't expecting the quality be exactly the same like their Atlanta's branch, but it definitely was.

I had the food delivered. The quality was amazing and the food was warm. The portions are quite big and they added extra sides for us. The quality of the food is like when you order from one of the best kitchens in Tehran.
Amazing food, service and staff. Definitely worth a visit. Love those Persian songs.
Great experience from we walked in till we left. Great staff, great food and great set up.
The best Persian food ever!

This intimate restaurant has delectable Persian food, a seductive ambiance, and excellent customer service. Everything we tried was delicious, but some particular show-stopping dishes included the Kashk Badenjoon, a fried eggplant dish with cream of whey, crispy onion, and mint; the Shirin, an unbelievably tasty rice dish with orange zest, barberry, pistachio, and almond; the Koobideh Kabob, a kabob made with a seasoned chuck, hanger, & brisket ground beef blend, and; last, but CERTAINLY not least, a mind-blowing baklava served with cardamom ice-cream that knocked my socks off. They also have some great cocktails, including the Glimpse of Paradise, which has vodka, grapefruit, cardamom syrup, lemon, and mint. This restaurant is simply divine, I’d highly recommend it!!!! Lovely restaurant, looking forward to going here again. :)
Really fantastic upscale Persian cuisine. Absolutely gorgeous decor and atmosphere. A bit too much hype however. But really solid overall.

We had a fabulous dinner at Rumi’s Kitchen tonight. The food and the service was great; I felt like I was eating as a guest at the home of a Persian friend—not at a restaurant. Crystal, our server, was especially attentive and kind. Plus we all felt very safe in this meticulously clean and well run place. By the way, it was our first dining experience inside a restaurant in last five months.  I cannot wait to go there again when we are next in DC!

Celebrated parent's 35 years wedding anniversary with success at Rumi's Kitchen. They delivered an exceptional service. We had a reservation and were seated in two minutes. Service was top notch, appetizers showed up quick followed by a great and fantastic food service. Their Soltani was outstanding, delicious and very well portioned. Prices were perfect and parking was very easy next door. Overall a 10/10 experience.

The best Persian restaurant I’ve ever visited. I’m half-Persian, so well versed but no true expert. There are two aspects that make Rumi’s Kitchen great and without a doubt worth a visit: The food is incredible. These are the home cooked classics that my aunts would prepare for everyday meals and large family get togethers. The renditions here could be, I dare say, better than my aunts’ versions? They definitely took me back to my childhood, which is the most I could ask for. The second is the service. For those familiar with the Persian custom of Taarof, the staff does a fantastic job of making you feel welcome and comfortable. They explained and promoted the food well to my non-Persian guests, but did not push too much in a way that feels inauthentic. We left stuffed like I would after my grandmother would pile more rice and kabob on my plate, but completely happy with our service and care. This is an easy recommendation.
Excellent definitely try it
Amazing experience. Professional service and best Persian food
Awesome food, atmosphere and service! A little bit more expensive than other persian restaurants in the dc area but totally worth it!
Incredible food and service. Great wine and drink list too.

Exceptional service, beautiful ambiance, very Covid observant. Food was pretty good, but being persian myself with pretty high standards for the cuisine, I would give it B. The meat dishes were a bit over-cooked for my taste. The Koobideh at Shamshiry in VA is much better. The rice dishes and appetizers however were great. The portions are generous as it should be. Overall a very authentic experience with decent food.  Must stress how beautifully it was designed and the ambiance is perfection.
Amazing food, service and atmosphere, definitely suggested.
If you are a fan of Persian/Mediterranean food you should definitely try Rumi’s kitchen. The staff are friendly, the food is great, and the ambiance is lovely! Highly recommend.
I can say this is the best Persian restaurant in the US I’ve ever been. The food is extremely tasty. Very clean environment. Polite staff.
One of the best Persian food in DMV area .
Tasty 😋
Best Persian restaurant I have ever been to
Amazing, authentic food and amazing service!! Can’t wait to come back
Truly authentic Persian foods, tasty cocktails, and great hospitality.

Absolutely an INCREDIBLE Restaurant.  We moved to the D.C. area from Alpharetta Georgia 2 years ago, and in addition to missing our friends and family, missed the meals at Rumi's Alpharetta and Rumi's Sandy Springs.  Their food and service were 1st class at both restaurants.  We were invited by friends of the owner, Ali Mesghali, to the 'soft opening' on "L" Street in Washington D.C.  The restaurant was amazing, the staff and service perfect, the 'social distancing' exactly as it should be, and the food, well the food was truly INCREDIBLE as usual.  Everything we ordered was served perfectly by very well trained wait staff, and cooked to perfection.  Being of Greek decent, I love lamb and I have tasted Lamb from many countries around the world and Rumi's is certainly the best.  Everything Ali does is 1st class and upscale which reflects in his restaurants.  This has to be one of the best restaurants in the D.C, Virginia area.  Well done!!

The food is delicious and the staff provides polite and professional service. We had a wonderful experience and ate a lot. Appetizers were irresistible, the main dishes were amazing, and the desert was unforgettable! A true 5 star restaurant in DC.

This is 1000% the best Persian restaurant you'll find in the DC area, so look no further. The food and atmosphere are equally amazing and the service is exceptional. I ordered the barg kabob and it was literally the best I've ever had in my entire life. can't speak highly enough of this place. After trying almost all the hottest restaurants this city has to offer, I was blown away by the calibur of Rumi's kitchen. This place is surely a gem you don't want to miss out on!
The Food is amazing and the service is outstanding. Best Persian cuisine I have ever had. Definitely the place to go for a great ambiance and fantastic food.
